What Eclipse build are you using? Thanks.

I am using version 3.0, from the file eclipse-SDK-3.0M8-linux-gtk.zip

Thanks,

Roberto

PS. By the way, this version is running ok on windows. version 2.1 is
running ok on my linux.

I don't understand this stack trace.  It says that the VM is Sun 1.4.2 yet 
Xerces is showing up on the stack.  Sun 1.4 VMs ship with the Crimson XML 
parser.  How is it that you are running Xerces?  Have you modified the endorsed 
dir or the command line in some way?

Further, most Xerces implementations that I know of do actually support string 
interning.

Something strange is happening.  Need more information on your setup.
Is this happening every time?
Can you try a more recent build?

Jeff, 

you are absolutelly right. I had xerces in my jre/lib/ext
directory. I still can not run the eclipse but now the 
problem is with my gtk libs (2.0.2).

Thank you,

Roberto
